content: The only service that can enforce federal laws is the US Coast Guard. DOD MP/SP/AP enforce the UCMJ or other specific laws that apply only to military facilities and personnel. Please go to the CG forums to ask about a Maritime LE career.

content: quote: The only service that can enforce federal laws is the US Coast Guard. i don't think the poster was stuck on federal law enforcement, but l.e. in general. keep in mind every service's law enforcement is kind of the same but differs for each of their missions. the first thing you should figure out is which mission you would rather support. how important airborne schools is in regards to your decision?

content: Master at Arms right now in the Navy is becoming overmanned so it is very difficult to make E5 and E6. It went from not being able to start off there having to serve time and then crossrate over, to new Recruits being allowed to be MAs. So if you are looking at it for that then try something else instead. If you want to do law enforcement after the military then find out locally what the requirements are. Standard these days is a College degree but often they will not hire those who did that field in the military. Training and ways are different and not necessarily what they want. Except for Marines I believe their training is very similar.
